connector.description:
Send data to a MariaDB Database.

In you KameletBinding file you'll need to explicitly declare the MariaDB Server driver dependency in spec->integration->dependencies

- "mvn:org.mariadb.jdbc:mariadb-java-client:<version>"

This Kamelet expects a JSON as body. The mapping between the JSON fields and parameters is done by key, so if you have the following query:

'INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)'

The Kamelet needs to receive as input something like:

'{ "username":"oscerd", "city":"Rome"}'

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.serverName.description: Server Name for the data source Example: localhost

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.port.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.port
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.port.description: Server Port for the data source

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.username.description: The username to use for accessing a secured MariaDB Database

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.password.description: The password to use for accessing a secured MariaDB Database

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.query.description: The Query to execute against the MariaDB Database Example: INSERT INTO accounts (username,city) VALUES (:#username,:#city)

camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName.name: camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName
camel.kamelet.mariadb-sink.databaseName.description: The Database Name we are pointing
